title: How to get full funding for college as a transfer student - Quora

response.answer_text: All full funding comes with you supplying something of value. One option is to join the United States military. Qualify for the GI bill. Get the government to pay for your college education. If you don’t want to risk your life for full funding I suggest you look at scholarships from employers who will pay for your degree for 3 to 5 years of your life working for them.

I hope you are a star athlete and have done some amazing academic work with incredible grades. That’s how you get a totally free ride. However not many people are that lucky (or brilliant). There is no full funding as a college student. The family of the student and the student are required to make some sort of financial contribution to the student’s education. You can apply for financial aid and they will dole out money in the form of grants, scholarships and loans based on both academic and “need”. Your parents have to fill out an application that will be a profile of the financial status of the family.

One of two ways: You and all of your parents fill out all of the required financial aid forms for each of the collegesOr you get recruited to play a varsity sport like football, ice hockey or basketball at the D-1 level as those are the only ones that guarantee a full athletic scholarshipAll the best.

Good luck. I received TAP from New York State for 4 years of my undergrad ($250 per semester) and that’s it. Nothing else, the rest of funding ($80,000) through loans. *I will say if you land a scholarship (<3.5 gpa in most cases) they may cover a chunk of your tuition.. I’ll also say that room and board is the major cost component regardless of where you go.

It can be by sponsorship you’ll receive by making a profitable product. It can be by need based aid but these schools accept not many students for example Yale and Harvard they give transfers aid but its incredibly difficult to get acceptance. By contests, some contests when you become first they’ll support you.

Scholarships are competitive and awarded to the most deserving students. All students are considered for merit-based scholarships. Every university offers various scholarships; you can refer to the university’s website for scholarship details. Additionally, you can consider approaching various trusts such as Lady Meherbai D. Tata Education Trust, Aga Khan Foundation, Jawaharlal Nehru Memorial trust scholarships and Nanabhoy Jejeebhoy Charity Trust which offer loan and grants to students seeking education. Please contact these individual institutes for further details.
